docs.title: pyomarker
docs.text:
Bayesian and classical methods for quantitative imaging biomarker reliability and uncertainty.

Quantitative imaging biomarkers are increasingly used in clinical research, yet their repeatability and uncertainty are often poorly characterised. pyomarker provides well-defined frequentist and Bayesian tools for analysing test–retest data, estimating measurement reliability, and quantifying uncertainty in imaging biomarker studies. It leverages Hamiltonian Monte Carlo sampling of parameter posterior distributions through the Stan probabilistic programming framework.

docs.title: Key features
docs.text:
• Classical repeatability metrics (Bland–Altman, ICC, CoV)
  • Bayesian models for uncertainty-aware biomarker analysis
  • Designed for quantitative imaging workflows

⚠️ Development status pyomarker is under active development. APIs may change. If you would like more information about upcoming releases, please contact me.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
pip install pyomarker

📘 Documentation: https://icr-computational-imaging.github.io/pyomarker/

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
import numpy as np
from pyomarker.models.test_retest.real.bland_altman import BlandAltman

x1 = np.array([1.2, 1.4, 1.1, 1.3])
x2 = np.array([1.3, 1.5, 1.0, 1.2])

ba = BlandAltman(ci=0.90).fit(x1, x2)
print(ba.metrics())

Check our examples page for more.

docs.title: pyomarker.models.test_retest.real.bland_altman
docs.text: Tools for classical repeatability calculations

docs.title: between_subject_mean_squares(x1, x2) staticmethod
docs.text: Between subject, mean squares of paired measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ bsms = \frac{2}{N} \sum_{i=1}^{N} (\bar{x}_{i} - \mu)^{2} \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

bsms.

docs.title: between_subject_standard_deviation(x1, x2) staticmethod
docs.text: Between subject standard deviation of paired measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ \sigma_{b} = \sqrt{(bsms - wsms) / 2} \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

The standard deviation.

docs.title: coefficient_of_repeatability(x1, x2, ci=0.9) staticmethod
docs.text: The coefficient of repeatability of paired baseline measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ r = 1.96 \times \sqrt{2} \times s_{w} \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required ci float

The confidence interval. Must be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.9.

0.9

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

The coefficient of repeatability.

NDArray NDArray

The coefficient of repeatability confidence interval. Structure: (lower, upper).

docs.title: coefficient_of_variation(x1, x2) staticmethod
docs.text: The coefficient of variation on raw paired baseline measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ CoV = \sigma_{w} / \mu \times 100\% \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

The coefficient of variation.

docs.title: fit(x1, x2)
docs.text:
Fit the Bland-Altman model to data

Note: This class assumes that the data are from two timepoints only.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description BlandAltman BlandAltman

A reference to self.

docs.title: intraclass_correlation_coefficient(x1, x2, ci=0.9) staticmethod
docs.text: The intra-class correlation coefficient of paired baseline measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ ICC = \frac{\sigma_{b}^{2}}{\sigma_{b}^{2} + \sigma_{w}^{2}} \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required ci float

The confidence interval. Must be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.9.

0.9

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

The coefficient of repeatability.

NDArray NDArray

The coefficient of repeatability confidence interval. Structure: (lower, upper).

docs.title: metrics()
docs.text:
Calculate summary of repeatability metrics.

Returns:

Type Description Dict[str, Any]

Dict[str, Any]: The metrics dictionary.

docs.title: population_mean(x1, x2) staticmethod
docs.text: Population mean of paired measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ \mu = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^{N} \frac{1}{2}\,(x_{1i} + x_{2i}) \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

The population mean.

docs.title: ratio_coefficient_of_variation(x1, x2) staticmethod
docs.text: The coefficient of variation on log-transformed paired baseline measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
$$ CoVr = \sqrt{e^{\sigma_{w}^{2}} - 1} \times 100\% $$ where \(\sigma_{w}\) is the within subject standard deviation of the logarithm of paired baseline measurements.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Raises:

Type Description ValueError

If any elements of x1 or x2 are less than or equal to 0.

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

The (ratio) coefficient of variation.

docs.title: ratio_limits_of_agreement(x1, x2, ci=0.9) staticmethod
docs.text: The limits of agreement derive from log-transformed paired baseline measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
$$ LoA = [\exp(±1.96\times \sqrt{2} \times s_{w}) - 1] \times 100\% $$ where \(\sigma_{w}\) is the within subject standard deviation of the logarithm of paired baseline measurements.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required ci float

The confidence interval. Must be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.9.

0.9

Raises:

Type Description ValueError

If any elements of x1 or x2 are less than or equal to 0.

Returns:

Name Type Description NDArray NDArray

The (ratio) limits of agreement. Structure: (negative, positive).

NDArray NDArray

The (ratio) limits of agreement confidence interval. Structure: (negative/lower, negative/upper, positive/lower, positive/upper).

docs.title: within_subject_mean(x1, x2) staticmethod
docs.text: Per subject mean.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ \bar{x}_{i} = \frac{1}{2}\,(x_{1i} + x_{2i}) \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description NDArray NDArray

1D array within subject means.

docs.title: within_subject_mean_squares(x1, x2) staticmethod
docs.text: Within subject, mean squares of paired measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ wsms = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^{N} (x_{1i} - \bar{x}_{i})^{2} + (x_{2i} - \bar{x}_{i})^{2} \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

wsms

docs.title: within_subject_standard_deviation(x1, x2, ci=0.9) staticmethod
docs.text: Within subject standard deviation of paired measurements.

docs.title: Definition
docs.text:
\[ \sigma_{w} = \sqrt{\frac{1}{2N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}(x_{2i} - x_{1i})^{2}} \]

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default x1 NDArray

1D array of baseline measurements.

required x2 NDArray

1D array of repeat baseline measurements.

required ci float

The confidence interval. Must be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.9.

0.9

Returns:

Name Type Description float float

The within subject standard deviation.

NDArray NDArray

The within subject standard deviation confidence interval. Structure: (lower, upper).
